newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria sells copper smelter to Belgium firm.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria sells copper smelter to Belgium firm.

text.p: Bulgaria's Privatisation Agency said on Monday it had accepted the offer of Belgium's Union Miniere SA to buy 56 percent of the MDK copper smelter.
An agency statement said the positions of the two bidders, Union Miniere and Swiss firm Glencore International, had been almost equal in the separate parts of the offer.

Following negotiations with the two bidders, the agency has evaluated their offers related to solving environmental problems in the region, development of production, production investments, social programmes and offered price, the statement said. It gave no further details.
Agency officials said the price of the deal would be announced on signing an agreement with the Belgium firm.
Another 30 percent of the smelter, whose turnover was $111.4 million in 1994 and $168 million in 1995, have been offered for mass voucher privatisation.
Officials say renovation of the smelter, which has equipment dating back to 1958, would help reduce pollution.
The World Bank said last December it was willing to help finance capacity expansion, upgrading and solving environmental problems of MDK once the company is privatised.
The plant's annual copper production capacity is up to 50,000 tonnes now, officials said.
MDK imports some 30 percent of its raw materials. It made a profit of more than 2.4 billion levs last year and some $3 million in 1995, MDK executive director said.
